general: This law was passed in 2003 and has to do with healthcare in Wales. It created something called "Community Health Councils" which are groups of people who help make sure that health services in their area are good and meet the needs of the community. The law also established a place called the "Wales Centre for Health" which helps to improve the quality of healthcare in Wales. Additionally, the law made provisions for the creation of "Health Professions Wales", an organization that helps to ensure that health professionals in Wales have the skills and knowledge they need to provide high-quality care.

series.short: "Improving Healthcare in Wales: Establishment of Health Professions Wales and Enhanced Regulation"
series.text:
* Simplified point 1: The Health (Wales) Act 2003 aims to improve the healthcare system in Wales by creating a new body called Health Professions Wales (HPW) to oversee healthcare professions and support workers.
* Simplified point 2: HPW will have functions related to healthcare professions and support workers, including entering into arrangements with professional bodies and making payments to the Centre.
* Simplified point 3: The National Assembly for Wales has the power to make orders and regulations under the Act, including providing for the transfer of functions between bodies and making financial provision.
* Simplified point 4: The Act also includes provisions for minor and consequential amendments and repeals, as well as transitional and saving provisions.
* Simplified point 5: The Act extends to England and Wales only, and its extent is the same as that of the enactment amended or repealed.

summary: The Health (Wales) Act 2003 is a law that aims to improve the healthcare system in Wales by creating a new body called Health Professions Wales (HPW). This body will oversee healthcare professions and support workers, ensuring they meet high standards and provide good care to patients. HPW will also work closely with professional bodies to set standards and provide training for healthcare professionals. Additionally, the Act gives the National Assembly for Wales the power to make orders and regulations to ensure the smooth running of the healthcare system. This means that the Assembly can make changes to the law if needed, such as transferring functions between different bodies or making financial provision. Overall, the Act aims to improve patient care and make sure that healthcare professionals are held to high standards.
single:
* Establishes the Wales Centre for Health to provide information and research on health matters in Wales.
* Transfers functions of Community Health Councils in Wales to the National Assembly for Wales.
* Establishes Health Professions Wales to carry out functions on behalf of the Assembly in relation to health care professions and support workers.
* Provides for the transfer of staff and property of the Centre and Health Professions Wales to the Assembly.
* Allows the Assembly to make payments to the Centre and Health Professions Wales.
* Gives the Assembly the power to make regulations and orders under the Act.
* Provides for the repeal of certain enactments and makes minor and consequential amendments.
* Makes financial provision for the increase in sums payable out of money provided by Parliament.
* Provides for the short title, commencement, and extent of the Act.
EXPLANATION:
This Act aims to improve the protection and improvement of health in Wales by establishing the Wales Centre for Health, transferring functions of Community Health Councils to the National Assembly for Wales, and establishing Health Professions Wales to carry out functions on behalf of the Assembly. The Act also provides for the transfer of staff and property, allows the Assembly to make payments, and gives the Assembly the power to make regulations and orders under the Act. Additionally, the Act repeals certain enactments and makes minor and consequential amendments. Finally, the Act provides for the short title, commencement, and extent of the Act.
